name: The Fairmont Banff Springs

reviews.title: "An Expensive Disappointment"
reviews.text: "An expensive disappointment " are the words my husband used to describe this hotel as we drove away from it after our two night stay there.

reviews.title: Great Canadian Flagship
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel as part of our Journey Through the Clouds Discovery Drive tour which was booked entirely through The Rocky Mountaineer who were excellent. We chose to stay exclusively in Fairmont Hotels on the Gold Floor and requested view rooms as it was a special wedding anniversary.

reviews.title: Amazing, I didn't want to leave.
reviews.text: Fortunately for Fairmont, the Banff Springs was the fourth hotel out of the five that we stayed in. Had it been the only Fairmont hotel we chose to stay at we would never stay in a Fairmont hotel again.

reviews.title: Grand and Stately...a great old hotel!
reviews.text: Prior to our tour all four of the other hotels contacted me via email to see if they could be of any assistance making dinner reservations or booking excursions for us. I was impressed with this and was therefore suprised to receive nothing from the Banff Springs as it is supposed to be their flagship hotels in the Rockies. I contacted the hotel myself requesting a dinner reservation for the night of our wedding anniversary and several days later got a nonsensical reply making no mention of our stay or request for dinner reservation.

reviews.title: Renovated rooms are very nice
reviews.text: Prior to staying at Banff Springs we had had a wonderful stay at Fairmont Lake Louise where we received exemplary service from the Gold Floor conceirge staff. We were sad to leave as everything at the hotel had been magical.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here last week with my boyfriend. We arrived early and were able to check into our room right away which we really appreciated. On the negative side, the hotel is a little far from the 'town centre' and the hotel shuttle does not go there. We were looking forward to going to the outdoor pool to enjoy the beautiful surroundings but it was full of children and looked more like a hotel in Disney Land, so we just used the hot tub inside instead.
reviews.title: Not very pet friendly!!

reviews.text: We travelled with our puppy and whilst the hotel advertises that it is 'pet friendly' we really did not feel that was the case at all. We were put in a corner room in a separate wing (we thought this was because of the dog). The hotel don't like you to leave your pet unattended in the room which was fine with us, but when we tried to get some food we were not able to eat anywhere in the hotel! We tried to go for a drink and my boyfriend picked it up at the bar and we sat where we thought was the 'general lobby area' and were asked to leave with our dog. I would like to note that our dog is small and very well behaved, it was sitting quietly at my feet between our chairs. We were in the corner of the room so no body would have even noticed he was there. I just feel like we were treated very poorly because we had our dog with us. They were happy to accept our 'pet fee' yet not our pet.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.text: We attended a conference at this hotel in August 2013. It was the best hotel experience ever. The hotel itself is out of this world, a castle in the most beautiful surroundings, but what made it extra special was the superb customer service. During my career I have stayed in many, many hotels but the level of friendly, helpful, cheerful and courteous service provided by the staff at this hotel is unsurpassed in my experience. I do not know what their secret is but I do know it works.
reviews.title: If only the management was as good as the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Banff Springs Hotel is set in a glacial valley in Banff. It was one of the most picturesque hotels I ever visited. But this property is old, tired, staffed by friendly but often incompetent people, and it costs a king’s ransom, over $500 a night for a very inadequate room with a double bed. Until the Fairmont renovates and learns how to treat its customers better, I am going to save myself the brain damage (discussed below) and money.
reviews.title: once in a lifetime

reviews.text: The hotel was built in 1888. The public spaces, exterior, and grounds all live up to the advertising. While I recommend against staying here, I do recommend you take a free “self-guided” walking tour of the hotel and its beautiful grounds. Or go have a drink there. Aesthetically, the property was even nicer than I expected. This is a Victorian-era castle built by the Canadian Pacific Railroad. They invested major capital to attract tourists to what once was the middle of nowhere.
reviews.title: Picture postcard

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for four days for a conference. Upon check-in the front desk agent asked us if we had been there before. We hadn't, and told her so, she reccomended a room for us in the presidential tower and we took her up on her offer. Our room, which needed two elevators to get to, was unique. It was very small but well appointed. Our floor had only six other rooms on it. We were up quite high in the tower and had a great view out of our window. The bed was comfortable, though not as comfortable as other Fairmonts I have stayed in. This hotel is worth staying in for the grandeur alone. Exploring it is so much fun and it's beauty is truely amazing. The pool area is nice and the hot tub even better. The meals that were served to the conference members were superb! Our only complaint was the extra fee for parking. When we were already paying a high rate for the room, paying an extra $19 a night for parking seemed excessive.
reviews.title: Wonder in the Rockies

reviews.text: I traveled with friends to the Fairmont Banff Springs during August, which is a great time to be in Banff. Of course, many others know this so expect traffic and crowds as the trade-off to enjoying that mountain scenery when the summer weather is at its best.
reviews.title: Luxury in the mountains

likes.liked: — Amazing facility set right in the mountains and next to fun town
likes.disliked: — Lack of guest room balconies to enjoy the views even more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Banff is less than two hours from the Calgary airport via the Trans Canada Highway expressway and you don’t have to cross over any mountain passes. You will have to purchase a Banff park pass to get to Banff so be ready for that expense which is based on number of days you’re staying. The scenery and the town itself are terrific and make Banff one of the most ideal locations for a summer mountain travel destination.
reviews.title: What's the fuss?

reviews.text: There are many outstanding places to stay in and around Banff but I strongly recommend the Fairmont Banff Springs because it’s a destination in its own right, and because for those times when you want to be surrounded by so many activities that you don’t have to leave the resort, the Fairmont is the perfect choice.
reviews.title: Chance of a lifetime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was just the latest in repeat visits for me and my friends to do a hiking and golfing trip in Banff and we always stay at the Fairmont.
reviews.title: Pretty Castle

likes.liked: — We got a great price and the service was wonderful.
likes.disliked: — The only cheap parking option was a little bit of a walk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spectacular and world renowned.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Comfortable, Way Overpriced

likes.disliked: — The room was old, tired, bathroom moldy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And expensive as heck.
reviews.title: Wonderful Moscow Mules !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are, as you might expect from a property of this age- tired. Our room had tired old carpet, bathroom had a moldy TINY shower, room furniture out of the 1960's.
reviews.title: Fantastic Scenery

likes.liked: — The scenery, cleanliness, food and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner at the Banffshire Club, at $500+ for two of us, was excellent, but $500+? Service was superb (and in a different universe than the Fairmont Lake Louise where were experienced poor service).
reviews.title: You have to go in the Winter....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our two-night stay at the Banff Springs was uniformly excellent. When we arrived we were routed to the Fairmont President's Club registration desk (one of the many perks of membership) at the back of the hotel overlooking the Bow River Valley. We'd originally booked a single king room with a mountain view, and were upgraded to a double queen room because our original room wasn't ready when we arrived. The desk staff were very pleasant despite having several parties arrive at once, including us, and took the time to go over dining options and explain the basics of the hotel's layout.
reviews.title: Life in the castle

likes.disliked: — Price, charges for fitness and Internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 8th floor of the tower, at the end of a long hallway, and overlooked the traffic circle below. It was quite large and well laid-out, with room for the two beds, a dining table and two chairs, a blanket box, and a unit with TV, fridge, coffee maker and a couple of drawers. The closet was smallish (but plenty big enough for us) and was lit, which is a nice touch; it contained a small safe, ironing board and iron, and (alleluia!) a kettle. (Too many hotels overlook this necessary item; running water through a coffeemaker to heat it is messy at best, and can result in water with coffee overtones, an issue if you don't like or drink the stuff.) The bathroom was small and nicely organized, with good quality toiletries and a much-appreciated night light. Robes and slippers for 4 were provided.
reviews.title: Worth every penny!
beautiful place
reviews.text: The property has the look and feel of a castle, and we set off exploring shortly after we arrived. There is a skywalk with great valley and mountain views on the 8th floor (to the left as you leave the elevators), and all sorts of nooks and crannies. At the end of the 8th floor west hallway there is a tiny staircase up to additional guest rooms right under the eaves; we found out later that these were honeymoon suites. The 6th floor should not be missed: turn right from the elevators and go all the way down the hall to get to the Vice-Regal Suite, where royalty has stayed when in Banff -- this is probably the most castle-like area in the hotel, complete with royal portraits and candle lanterns.

reviews.title: Once in a lifetime
reviews.text: I highly recommend taking the 50-minute tour of the hotel, which begins at 3:00 p.m. six(?) days of the week. It's free for guests and $10 for others, and you need to sign up for it with the concierge desk. (At minimum, have a look through the little heritage gallery on M1, at the top of the stairs from the main lobby, where the hotel's hsitory is featured.) Tony, the kilted gentleman that will likely greet you when you arrive, was our tourguide, taking us around various places in the building and telling us some of its secrets... like the fossils in the stairs, the crests in Mount Stephen Hall, celebrity guests, fancy weddings, etc.

There's a pathway down to the Bow Falls from the back of the hotel (turn right at the Willow Stream Spa entrance), which shouldn't be missed. From the Falls you can walk along the Bow Falls Trail into Banff, also highly recommended if weather permits (about 20 minutes; some stair-climbing involved).
reviews.title: Do not believe the hype!
Don't waste your money
reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this hotel. If we had not already prepaid American Express for this vacation, we would have left. The room was terribly expensive which would have been okay if it had been a decent room. It was very small and a complete let down. The paint on the ceiling of the bathroon was peeling. The shower was moldy with dark blotches on the bottom of the tub, the carpet was worn, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is like a fairy land castle with the most beautiful views of the mountains. Our room on the 4th floor was a very large room, with great views. The bathroom was unacceptably small (I have had bigger on cruise ships). We hired a gypsy guide for the car which I also found through trip advisor and it was fantastic it was like having a private guide in the car with you the whole time. It pointed out so many things that you would normally drive past and gave you many options of different areas to visit. The hotel offers guided tours of the castle some afternoons (complimentary for guests) and this is really worthwhile doing.
reviews.title: A Charming Hotel

reviews.text: Previously people have complained about the cost of the internet. If you join the Fairmont hotels Presidents Club which is free of charge then you have unlimited use of the internet, plus many other benefits including discounts in the hotel shops. It is definitely worthwhile joining before you arrive.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great views

reviews.text: On each floor of the hotel they have free ice machines and soft drink vending machines. We were lucky with magnificent warm weather every day and clear blue skies so that made our stay even more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there with my wife and son in Aug 2011 for one night as an experience while touring the beautiful Banff and Jasper national parks. The staff were friendly and helpful. The buildings are impressive and were well maintained as were the grounds. There is quite a beautiful view from the gardens at the back of the hotel. We stayed in the annex wing near the multilevel parking garage but had a nice view of the gardens from our window. The restaurants are pricey and even the buffet breakfast is pricey compared to other Fairmont hotels in Canada. The restaurants require reservations for dinner. We ate in Banff instead and there is a good choice of restaurants in Banff. Parking is an extra cost of 30 dollars for self-parking or 35 for valet per day. I tried the valet parking but changed to self parking after waiting more than 15 minutes to have the car brought around. If you are staying in the annex, the valet parking is not worth the bother since it is quicker to just walk over to the parking garage than to the lobby in the other building, even though there is a second floor enclosed walkway between buildings. There are about 4 levels in the parking garage with stairs between and the lower levels are reserved for valet parking. It seems that the valet staff has to run to the garage to retrieve the cars so I suppose that that explains the delay. Overall, we really enjoyed the hotel but not as much as other Canadian Fairmont hotels at Montebello and LaMalbaie, Quebec.
reviews.title: Castle in the Mountains

reviews.text: I stayed at the Fairmont Banff Springs a few months ago on business. I was there for four days. My experience from the moment I checked in to the the moment I checked out was excellent. The front desk staff was friendly and the concierge was EXTREMELY helpful. The restaurants on property were nice. I especially enjoyed the Banffshire Club. Nice intimate atmosphere. The meeting space was ample and the banquet food was nice. I did find there banquet menus to be a bit inflexible though. My room was large and the bed was very comfortable. The views were spectacular and there is plenty to do right outside the front doors on the hotel. There is a trail right behind the hotel that takes you past a river, rapids and mountains and leads you directly into the village. The hotel is very pricey, but if you truly are looking for a great experience this is a place you must visit. Overall a great experience. I would love to bring my daughter back there some day.
reviews.title: Ah the views, ah the building....

reviews.text: Sure, all of the staff seem friendly – fixed smiles and knowing your name trying to ensure a tip – but you do get more than the odd 2 or 3 who certainly missed the last term of charm school.
reviews.title: Not enough value for money

reviews.text: Most of the rooms are very tired. We checked in (not until 5pm as the room was not ready) and were placed in the conference centre section of the hotel, in an annexe built a few years ago. But there was a big problem for us (and anyone else over there) – the static electricity in the building meant that everything you touched you had a shock from! It was so bad we had to move rooms, back to the main building (from room 1982 to 595).
reviews.title: Spectacular setting, great spa, 1 caveat

reviews.text: We also left a few items of clothing in the room between moves – and that was never to be seen again.
reviews.title: Stunning setting, impeccable staff vs. Super expensive, tired-looking room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to wait at breakfast for tour groups pushing through, a real scrum and not what was expected for a hotel of this supposed calibre.
reviews.title: Magnificent property and grounds!

reviews.text: Hotel was great! Perfect location, 12 minute walk to downtown banff area. Rooms are small, but that's expected with the age of the hotel. We were in a Stanley Thompson Mountain view suite, so a little more size but not huge. Pool area was great, kids loved it. The Restaurants were good, I'd recommend making reservations a week prior to arrival as the spaces are small and were filled the 1st few nights! The Samurai Sushi was very good, Castello's was good, and the Waldhous were the ones we ate in. All very good, service wasn't the greatest at Castello however. We horseback road on site, super fun 1 hr. ride. We golfed at the 9 hole course, where kids golf for free.....stunning scenery! Would for sure stay here again, fabulous trip!
reviews.title: Great Stay!! The whole place is one big postcard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful experience staying for a few days at this hotel. The service was unbelieveable, everybody was so polite, helpful and friendly; nothing was too much trouble. The hotel itself is stunning, inside and out, and the room was fabulous with a super comfy bed.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: We were in a deluxe mountain view room and the view was stunning. Breakfast was a buffet and it was fabby; everything you could possbily want. We ate in a few of the hotel restuarants and they were all excellent, but the Italian was our favourite; the food was outstanding as was the service.
reviews.title: Most beautiful site in North America?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a range of shops within the hotel and I was surprised that many of them were very reasonably priced. I bought a lot of my take-home pressies here.
reviews.title: Another excellent Fairmont hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not the cheapest place to stay, but well worth it for the experience.
reviews.title: Amazing experience, awesome location
Beautiful Banff
reviews.text: The Fairmont Banff Springs is a beautiful hotel with a breathtaking view of the Bow Valley. We were fortunate to have large, well appointed rooms on the 10th and 11th floors (accessed via separate elevator from the 9th), overlooking the valley.

reviews.title: Amazing service; loads of character; terrific restaurants!
reviews.text: We ate at the Bow Valley Grill and the food was honestly, quite mediocre, especially considering that the average entree was $40-50 (USD). The hotel is a short drive from the main town which has a selection of restaurants and shops. We enjoyed breakfast in the town rather than the hotel.

reviews.title: Who doesn't love to sleep in a castle?
reviews.text: Parking at the hotel is primarily (and most easily) achieved using the valet service - since there isn't a parking lot or deck to speak of. The valet service required a 15-20 minute advance notice, but was punctual and we were never left waiting for our car to arrive.

reviews.title: Expensive, but incredible
reviews.text: Later in the week we stayed at the Chateau Lake Louise, and Jasper Park Lodge, but Banff Springs was our favorite and we'd gladly return.

reviews.title: Bam...Great Hotel and experience
reviews.text: Stayed unfortunately only one night and caught the Banff/Vancouver train ride early the next morning. But can't rave enough about the night at the hotel. The service alone would rate the 5 stars in this 5-star hotel, but the hotel itself has so much character it's worth it for that alone. Because of our short stay, we chose to remain on the property rather than go into town. We had happy hour outdoors on the deck of the Waldhaus Pub, then upstairs for dinner with an amazing fondue, prepared authentically with beef broth in the European tradition. Afterwards, we took advantage of the live music at the Rundle Lounge where we joined others with a nightcap & dancing. !!! The only downside is that for such a high end property, the guests are beginning to err on the side of very casual dress (shorts, jeans, etc), and it's not much different that what you'd see at a hotel in Disneyland or another 3- or 4- star property. It'd be nicer if we, the guests, could dress even a tad more stylishly and match the surroundings as well as the service. Otherwise, a wonderful experience!

When checking in, there was a long line of cars. I couldn't leave the car to check in and had to park in the garage and walk back. Not the greeting I expect from a high end hotel. Our room was right next to the elevators and my wife couldn't sleep due to the noise. A drunk group of wedding revelers who were singing past 2:00 am didn't help.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our mistake - we didn't know we were booking on one of Canada's 3-day weekends (the "August long weekend"). The hotel was full, so when we had an issue with the loud music coming from one of the wedding receptions on the Mezzanine Level and asked to be relocated, we were told our room type (Signature Mountain View Room) would not be available for two more nights, and that yes, there were going to be continued wedding receptions each night. After explaining that wasn not going to be acceptable, they simply said "sorry, it's the best we can do." I was shocked, but the Fairmont staff came through and called 15 minutes later with a room on the 6th floor. They saved their well-earned reputation (and my opinion of their service reputation). Thank you!
reviews.title: Beautiful Property, Great Location, Crowded!

reviews.text: The restaurants were great, as was the spa, and the hotel itself is an amazing blend of old world architecture and new world style. The room (and proeprty) was beautiful, the bed comfortable, and the views stunning. This one should be on your “bucket list” if you love castles, mountains, rivers, and outdoor beauty.
reviews.title: Spectacular Grand Hotel

reviews.text: Castle like hotel that looks like it is growing right out of the majestic Canadian Rockies. Our rooms on Gold Floor were ridiculously small. Only room for one person in the bathroom at a time, and no counter space to speak of. The gold lounge and staff were wonderful.
reviews.title: wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Golf is spectacular, except no real red tees, just markers in the fairway.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel and Gardens

reviews.text: Aug 2013 Just back from what should have been lots of great scenery and roughed outdoors topped with and the luxury of the Fairmont BUT boy I was incredibly disappointed. It started with confusion on check in that never really got sorted out (4 rooms under one name that needed to be separated was beyond their bandwidth) ,helpless reception staff who said they could not even call to avoid the same confusion at our next reservation at Lake Louise to a tiny room that was dusty and old, and forget the bathroom. UGH. I don't mind paying when you get quality and service but this was terrible. Right down to when we booked horseback riding the mosquitos were so thick we could barely ride without the bug spray offered by another group who WAS forewarned by their hotel concierge. And forget about valet...give up your car and you will be lucky to see it an hour after you call. Finally, so much for not tipping, which is the hotel policy, they all were happy/expected them, even when the luggage arrived in the wrong rooms an hour late.
reviews.title: Needs a major overhaul for the price being charged

reviews.text: NB: Fairmont Jasper was nice but also needs a major facelift and the service was just as bad. Had to call several times just for a hairdryer! Very expensive cabin to stay in...and not at all up to par. (yes, I am a hotel snob and stay at the Ritz Carlton regularly at the SAME price point for MUCH better service/quality)
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: Fairmont Lake Louise Club level was our third and final stop and we were forced to go to the club level just to get central air! theyr are so many tourist in the lobby and the grounds it's lie a circus. Oh well......at least the club level was lovely.
reviews.title: Worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I work, and stay in many 4 star brands. I have the opportunity to visit many hotels and this one bar none is the best hotel I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: The BEST

reviews.text: The exterior is amazing, the interior is gorgeous, unlike most fairmonts the old style feels right (most feel gaudy to me). The room we got, the honeymoon suite, was more than can be desired with a jacuzzi, spiral stair case to the bedroom, massive shower..
reviews.title: Second to none!
Wonderful Experience
reviews.text: We had seen pictures of the hotel since we were children. We finally were able to take our first trip to the Canadian Rockies this year. Everything that has developed in Banff is a result of the railroad and this hotel. As first timers, we wanted to experience this grand old place.

reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel!!
reviews.text: And it did not disappoint. The location and views are astounding. The service and staff were very good. It truly feels like you are staying at a castle in the mountains. We thoroughly enjoyed our two night stay. How can anybody go to Banff and not want to experience this historic treasure at least once?

reviews.title: Amazing winter getaway
reviews.text: Some people say it is too expensive. Well, considering the uniqueness, the history, and the service, we felt it was worth it. And we received a substantial discount by booking the AAA rate.

reviews.title: Oh Canada
reviews.text: Not every visitor who comes to Banff stays here. But they all come to take a look. That should tell you all you need to know.

reviews.title: Make your Christmas perfect and stress free!
reviews.text: I was in Banff for the May Long Weekend with my boyfriend. Because I am a Travel Agent, I can receive good accommodation rates at certain hotels. We were able to stay at the Fairmont Banff Springs for about $100 per night. What we weren’t aware of; however, if that there was a parking fee (around $17) and a resort fee (I think around $15) that you are charged at check-out.
It was 12 years ago I stayed here when it was owned by Canadian Pacific Hotels. Fairmont has done a wonderful job in upgrading the hotel.
reviews.title: Vastly Improved Since My Last Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were lovely. We were on the fifth floor gold, and I would say it was worth the extra to upgrade to gold. There is a private lounge with complementary breakfast buffet, complimentary soft drinks and a 5-7pm evening appetisers. There is also an honor bar if you want alcohol.
reviews.title: Tooo Cooool!

reviews.text: There are lots of dining opportunities in the hotel all of which were good.
reviews.title: Amazing Place

reviews.text: Some of the people I was travelling with said their bathroom was small, but mine was fine so not all rooms are the same.
reviews.title: Magical!!!

reviews.text: Yes - it does cost an Arm and a Leg to stay here, but it truly is an awesome Hotel!
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous

description: Located in the heart of Banff National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the world famous Fairmont Banff Springs resort stands as a landmark in the picturesque alpine town of Banff. This year round luxury resort is styled after a Scottish baronial castle and offers guests spectacular mountain and valley views, a championship golf course during the summer, unparalleled skiing in the winter, and an award-winning European-style spa, the Willow Steam Spa.
